title: The Process of Ralph's character development in William Golding Lord of the Flies
abstract: Lord of the Flies is the first famous novel of William Golding. Lord of the Flies is an amazing story which tells about human weaknesses, namely Ralph. Ralph as the main male character of the story is influenced by some factors when he stays on the isolated island and makes him develops in his character. Therefore, the thesis writer wants to know what makes him develop and how does he develop whether there are factors that make him develop. In analyzing the process of Ralph?s character changes into develop, the thesis writer uses some literary approaches namely; characterization, conflict and also setting. The thesis writer finds out that there are factors that influence the main character?s development, they are his friendship with Piggy, his rivalry with Jack, and the environment.
contributors: CHERRY HADIKUSUMO, Dra. (Advisor 1); Stefanus Suprayitno (Examination Committee 1)
source: Undergraduate Thesis No.01011429/ING/2005; Yunie Kurniawati Sugio (11496142)
subjects: GOLDING, WILLIAM, 1911-1993. LORD OF THE FLIES--STUDY AND TEACHING; ENGLISH FICTION--20TH CENTURY--STUDY AND TEACHING
